Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: IKM Teradata Control Append COMPONENT VERSION: 10.1.3.3 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 10.1.3.5.0 and above
DESCRIPTION Integrates data in Teradatsa target table in truncate / insert (append) mode. Data can be controlled. Invalid data is isolated in the Error Table and can be recycled.
REQUIREMENTS - When using the RECYCLE_ERRORS option, you have to set an Update Key for your interface.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - INSERT: Execute insert commands? - COMMIT: Commit target transaction at the end of interface? - FLOW_CONTROL: Validate incoming data by a CKM? - RECYCLE_ERRORS: Recycle rejects from previous run? - STATIC_CONTROL: Validate data once loaded into target? - PRIMARY_INDEX: Specify primary index to be used on flow/ target table - DELETE_ALL: Delete all from target before loading? - VALIDATE: Validate KM options? - CREATE_TARG_TABLE: Create target table? - DELETE_TEMPORARY_OBJECTS: Drop ODI intermediate tables after load? - COLLECT_STATS: Collect statistics on flow and target table? - ODI_DDL: Specify, what DDL to be generated?
LIMITATIONS - When working with journalized data, if the "Synchronize deletions from journal" is executed, the deleted rows on the target are committed regardless of the COMMIT option - When using this module with a journalized source table, data are automatically filtered to not include source deletions. - The FLOW_CONTROL and STATIC_CONTROL options call the Check Knowledge Module to isolate invalid data (if no CKM is set, an error occurs). Both options must be set to NO in the case when an Integration Interface populates a TEMPORARY target datastore. - When COMMIT=NO, last drop flow statement issues warning, as table is still locked by pending transaction.
Automatically attempts to insert data into the Target Datastore of the Interface
Commit all data inserted in the target datastore.
Check this option if you wish to perform flow control.
Check this option to recycle data rejected from a previous control.
Check this option to control the target table after having inserted or updated target data.

Specify primary index for flow/target table. Teradata uses the PI to spread data accross AMPs. It is important that the chosen PI has a high cardinality (many distint values) to ensure evenly spread data to allow maximum processing performance. Pleaes follow Teradata's recommandation on choosing a primary index, e.g. Teradata Database Design, Chapter "Primary Indexes" Valid options are [PK] Primary key of flow/target table [UK] Update key set in interface <list of cols> This comma separated list of target columns defines the primary index. If no value is set (empty), no index will be created. NB: Teradata will automatically choose the first column of the table for the PI. [NOPI] Do not specify primary index for flow/target table (Teradata 13.0 & above only).
Check this option if you wish to delete all the rows of the target datastore.

This option generates an extra validation step during development. Validations performed are: - Validation of ODI_DLL option
This option should be turned off for all production use in particular for high-frequency execution. There is not added value in production, only processing overhead.
Check this option if you wish to create the target table
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.
no fallback, no before journal, no after journal
Additional options for the temporary I$ table. See documentation for valid values: - [NO] FALLBACK - [NO | DUAL] [BEFORE | AFTER] JOURNAL etc.
Collect stats on flow and target?
Collect statistics on primary index of flow and target table?

The generation of DDL commands can be controlled by setting ODI_DDL: DROP_CREATE Drop and recreate all ODI temp tables at every execution CREATE_DELETE_ALL Create all temp tables (ignore warnings) and use DELETE ALL DELETE_ALL Only submit DELETE ALL for all temp tables NONE Do not submit any DDL

<%if ( odiRef.getUserExit("FLOW_CONTROL").equals("1") ) { %> 
insert into	<%=odiRef.getTable("L","TARG_NAME","A")%>
( 
	<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "((INS and !TRG) and REW)")%> 
	<%=odiRef.getColList(",", "[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "((INS and TRG) and REW)")%> 
) 
select	<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "((INS and !TRG) and REW)")%> 
	<%=odiRef.getColList(",", "[EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "((INS and TRG) and REW)")%> 
from	<%=odiRef.getTable("L","INT_NAME","A")%>
where	(<%=odiRef.getColList("","[COL_NAME] ", "\n,", "", "PK=1")%>) not in (
		select 	<%=odiRef.getColList("","[COL_NAME] ", "\n,", "", "PK=1")%>
		from	<%=odiRef.getTable("L","ERR_NAME","W")%>
		where	ERR_TYPE	= '<%=odiRef.getInfo("CT_ERR_TYPE")%>'  
		and	ORIGIN	= '<%=odiRef.getInfo("CT_ORIGIN")%>'  
	)
<% } else { %> 
insert into	<%=odiRef.getTable("L","TARG_NAME","A")%> 
( 
	<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "(INS and REW)")%> 
) 
select	<%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> 
	<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[EXPRESSION]", ",\n\t", "", "(INS and REW)")%> 
from	<%=odiRef.getFrom()%> 
<% {s=""; if (odiRef.getPop("HAS_JRN").equals("0")) { s+=
"where	(1=1)";
	} else { s+=
"where	JRN_FLAG <> 'D'";
	 }; 
s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJoin();
s+=(char)10+odiRef.getFilter();
s+=(char)10+odiRef.getJrnFilter();
/* For Performance: suppress where clause, if empty */ 
if (!s.trim().equals("where	(1=1)")) {out.print(s);}; };%>
<%=odiRef.getGrpBy()%> 
<%=odiRef.getHaving()%> 
<% } %>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable("L","JRN_NAME","A")%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

<% if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0  && 
                     !odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]") ) { %>
collect stats using sample on  <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A")%> <% 
      /* update key used for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[UK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("column (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "UK") );
      /* use primary key for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("column (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "PK") );
      /* use column list for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0) 
          out.print( "column (" + odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX") + ")" );
%> 
<%} else { %>
-- No stats, as no PRIMARY_INDEX was specified
<%};%>

<%if ( odiRef.getUserExit("DELETE_TEMPORARY_OBJECTS").equals("1") ) { 
	%><% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { 

		%>locking table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%> for exclusive nowait
<%		%>drop table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%>

	<%} else {
		%>-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
	<%}%>
<% } %>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DELETE_ALL" )>-1) { %>
delete from <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%> all
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "DROP" )>-1) { %>
drop table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%>
<%} else {%> -- Disabled by ODI_DDL option <%}%>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )>-1) { %>

create <%=odiRef.getOption("FLOW_TABLE_TYPE")%> table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%>,
	<%=odiRef.getOption("FLOW_TABLE_OPTIONS")%>
(
	<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]\t[DEST_WRI_DT] " + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DDL_NULL"),  ",\n\t", "", "")%>,
	IND_UPDATE char(1)
)
<% /* use update key for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[UK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "UK") );
      /* use primary key for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "PK") );
      /* No PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]")) 
          out.print( " no primary index " );
     /* use column list for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0) 
          out.print( "primary index (" + odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX") + ")" );
%>

<%} else {%>
-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<%}%>

<%if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_METHOD"))){%> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

<% if (	odiRef.getOption("COLLECT_STATS").equals("1") &&
	odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0  && 
                     !odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]") ) { %>
collect stats using sample on  <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%> <% 
      /* update key used for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[UK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("column (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "UK") );
      /* primary key used for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("column (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "PK") );
      /* column list used for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0) 
          out.print( "column (" + odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX") + ")" );
	} else { %>
-- No stats, as no PRIMARY_INDEX specified or COLLECT_STATS disabled.
<%};%>

<%if ( odiRef.getUserExit("FLOW_CONTROL").equals("1") ) { %> insert into <%=odiRef.getTable("L","INT_NAME","W")%> ( <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "INS and REW")%> ) select DISTINCT <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[COL_NAME]", ",
	", "", "INS and REW")%> from <%=odiRef.getTable("L","ERR_NAME", "W")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> E where not exists ( select 'X' from <%=odiRef.getTable("L","INT_NAME","W")%> <%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> T where <%=odiRef.getColList("", "T.[COL_NAME]	= E.[COL_NAME]", "
		and	", "", "UK")%> ) and E.ORIGIN = '<%=odiRef.getInfo("CT_ORIGIN")%>' and E.ERR_TYPE = '<%=odiRef.getInfo("CT_ERR_TYPE")%>' <% } %>

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )>-1) { %>

create table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A")%>
(
	<%=odiRef.getTargetColList("", "[COL_NAME]\t[DEST_CRE_DT] " + odiRef.getInfo("DEST_DDL_NULL"), ",\n\t", "")%>
)
<% /* use update key for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[UK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "UK") );
      /* use primary key for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("unique primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "PK") );
     /* No PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]")) 
          out.print( " no primary index " );
      /* use column list for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0) 
          out.print( "primary index (" + odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX") + ")" );
%>

<%} else {%>
-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<%}%>
